definition[0]: a company’s profits from previous periods of time that have not been paid to shareholders
example[0]: They have invested their reserves very conservatively.
example[1]: It may dip into (=use part of) its  cash reserves of $800 million to pay the company in cash.
definition[1]: amounts kept aside by a company in its accounts to be used if needed. The amount a company has in reserves has to be taken away when calculating profit for a particular period of time
example[2]: The company had a loss of $15.2 million, or 74 cents a share, after setting up reserves to reflect property depreciation  (=falls in the value of property it owned).
definition[2]: money held by a bank and used to pay out money to customers when they ask for it. The amount that must be kept in this way is decided by government
example[3]: The Bank of Japan slashed by 40% the reserves banks must keep at the central bank.
definition[3]: an amount of something valuable such as oil, gas etc
example[4]: Petroleum reserves now amount to the equivalent of 142 days’ supply.
example[5]: The company needs to focus on building its coal and copper reserves.
